summary: "Fight Club" is a 1999 American movie directed by David Fincher, starring Brad Pitt, Edward Norton, and Helena Bonham Carter. Based on Chuck Palahniuk's 1996 novel, Norton plays an unnamed narrator who's unhappy with his job. He starts a secret fighting club with Tyler Durden (Pitt) and gets involved with a mysterious woman, Marla Singer (Bonham Carter). The film was controversial but became a cult classic over time, compared to famous movies like "Rebel Without a Cause" and "The Graduate." It explores Generation X's conflict with advertising and society's values.
title: Fight Club
